title: Evaluation and Application of Explicit Instruction for Students with Mathematical Learning Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematics pedagogy and general awareness of learning disabilities
context.additional_context: A practicum or special education-linked course emphasizing the ability to develop and utilize assessment tools applicable to real classroom situations

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and evaluate the five core elements of explicit instruction (activating prior knowledge, explicit explanation, systematic practice, feedback, and independent application) within a mathematics education context
Based on needs analysis of students with mathematics learning disabilities, learners can develop a checklist to assess the application level of explicit instruction in existing mathematics programs
Based on assessment results, learners can suggest improvement directions for mathematics programs and design lesson plans based on explicit instruction

resources: Case Materials for Students with Mathematics Learning Disabilities

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
